H0.text: Precipitation is the process most responsible for the disappearance of the puddle on a sidewalk that remained after a rain but was gone after a day of sunshine.

H1.text: Transpiration is the process most responsible for the disappearance of a puddle of water that remains on a sidewalk after a rain and is gone after a day of sunshine.

H2.text: Evaporation is the process most responsible for the disappearance of the puddle of water on the sidewalk after a day of sunshine following a rain.

H3.text: Condensation is the process most responsible for the disappearance of the puddle on the sidewalk after a day of sunshine following rain.

A4.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.

A5.text: When photons hits the surface area of the liquid they can make individual molecules break free and disappear into the air without any need for additional heat.
